intro: Anisomeris grandifolia, commonly known as the giant tarplant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its showy yellow to orange flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and can reach several feet in height. Anisomeris grandifolia is also noted for its ability to thrive in arid environments, making it an important species in desert ecosystems.
